title: 114_hr5570
content: The Act is titled the "Western Colorado Wilderness Study Area Release Act" and its purpose is outlined in the findings section. Congress finds that the public lands in the North Sand Hills Instant Study Area in Jackson County, Colorado have been adequately studied for wilderness designation. The Bureau of Land Management found in 1980 that the area did not meet wilderness criteria, and in 2011, Resolution 2011-01 supported the release of the area from further consideration for wilderness designation. The public lands in Dominguez Canyon and Black Ridge Canyons Wilderness Study Areas in Colorado have been adequately studied for wilderness designation, and the remaining acreage in these areas was excluded from wilderness designations. The purpose of this Act is to release certain Wilderness Study Areas from further consideration for wilderness designation. The purpose of this Act is to release certain Wilderness Study Areas from further consideration for wilderness designation and direct the Secretary of the Interior to manage those areas according to applicable land use plans. SEC. 3. RELEASE OF WILDERNESS STUDY AREAS. The North Sand Hills Instant Study Area and Dominguez Canyon Wilderness Study Area are no longer subject to certain sections of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976. They will now be managed according to the applicable land use plans. The Black Ridge Canyons Wilderness Study Area within the McInnis Canyons National Conservation Area is no longer subject to certain sections of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976. It will now be managed according to the applicable National Conservation Area land use plan. SEC. 4 amends boundaries along the Colorado River in the Conservation Area, ensuring no portion of the river is included. SEC. 5 authorizes certain land exchanges. Section 2405 of the Omnibus Public Land Management Act of 2009 is amended to allow the Secretary to exchange private land within a Conservation Area for Federal land to enhance the area's values and resolve trespass issues. The Secretary can exchange private land within a Conservation Area for Federal land, subject to applicable laws and valid existing rights.
